content.description: Stand start with a pair of incut crimps about four feet from the ground.  From there, work straight up the slab through a jagged right hand and the eventual solid topout.
content.protection: Pad, but the landing is primo.
content.location: This is on the South face of Coy Rock.

content.description: Stand start with a pair of incut crimps about four feet off the deck.  From there, work straight up the slab on good crimps to a solid topout.
content.protection: Bring a pad, but the landing is great.
content.location: This is on the South face of Coy Rock.

content.description: Stand start with a pair of incut crimps about four feet off the ground.  At that point, make a move up to the diagonal rail and top the problem out.
content.protection: Pad, the landing is good, but there is a large rock behind the problem.
content.location: This is on the South face of Coy Rock.

content.description: Stand start with a pair of incut crimps about four feet off the deck.  From there, work up the slab through the thin hands and feet and top it out.
content.protection: Pad, the landing is outstanding though.
content.location: This is on the South face of Coy Rock.

content.description: Sit start with a flat right hand edge and a left hand undercling-sidepull. From there, use the arete to gain the featured lip, and mantel atop the boulder.
content.protection: A pad will do. The landing is good.
content.location: It climbs the west side of the northwest arete.

content.description: On the Coy Rock, there is a short roof on the east side. Locate the "Brick in the Wall" on the lower right portion of the roof, and pinch the shit out of it. Go right to the arete and up.
content.location: This ascends the East side roof of Coy Rock.

content.description: On the Coy Rock, there is a short roof on the east face of the boulder. Locate the "Brick in the Wall" on the lower right portion of the roof, and pinch the shit out of it. Make a long move out left to some smaller crimps at the apex of the roof, and top out straight up.
content.location: This ascends the East face of Coy Rock.

content.description: This is kind of an eliminate... SDS on the "Brick in the Wall" undercling. Go straight up the slab without using either arete. The first move is the hard one, right hand up to crimp at about 5 feet height.  "All in all it's just another brick in the wall."
content.location: This ascends the center of the northeast face.
